title: Asbestos Lab Analyst P401 - West Yorkshire
description:
Our client is a well-established asbestos consultancy and are looking to recruit an experienced Asbestos Lab Analyst to join their busy team/laboratory in the West Yorkshire region. Applications will be considered from the Leeds, Bradford and Huddersfield areas.Candidates must be keen, focused and have gained the P401 asbestos certificate.Proven experience of working in a laboratory environment within the asbestos field is essential.Must possess good IT skills.Responsibilities:Receiving and appropriately logging samples received by the laboratory.Analyse and report on the fibre content of samples submitted by clients.Reporting analytical findings.Completing analysis test sheets as and when required.Carrying out any other laboratory duties as required.In general, you will be flexible and have the ability to organise your workload effectively.You will be a good team player whilst also having the ability to work independently. The company is offering a competitive salary, depending on experience, along with other benefits.Future Select are the leading market supplier for recruitment in the Asbestos industry, we work with the best clients & candidates and supply the majority of permanent jobs in the asbestos market. We have a large dedicated team, with over 25 years combined industry experience within Asbestos recruitment specifically geared to dealing with Asbestos Surveyors/Analysts/Lab Technicians, Administrators, Project/Regional /Technical/Quality/Training/Sales Managers through to Director level for both Consultancy & Removal. We have intrinsic knowledge of the market place, as well as respecting candidates/clients confidentiality in this close knit market sector.We are also interested in anyone with p401/p402/p403/p404/p404 or s301 CCP.For professional, and constructive advice on the market for candidates/clients, please call our leading marketing team on 01904 766611.We are inundated with applications, we will endeavour to get back in touch, however if you have applied to Future Select and you have not heard from us after a week, on this occasion, you will not have been successful. Your details will be saved on our system and you will be contacted in the future if a vacancy matches your skills.Future Select Copyright 2017.

title: Immunoassay Scientist
description:
Excellent opportunity with a leading analytical services company!Are you qualified to degree level in a Biological Science? Do you have at least 12 months’ laboratory experience gained through a placement or employment? Have you conducted immunoassays, cell-based assays or similar techniques? Then this could be the role for you!Working as part of a team you will play a key role in development and validation of assays to screen concentrations of drugs, peptides and proteins in various biological samples. Following initial training you will apply your skills and knowledge to carry out a range of techniques including immunoassays, cell-based assays, molecular biology and flow cytometry.The successful candidate will have:- A degree in a biological science (minimum 2:1)- At least 12 months’ lab-based employment experience using immunoassays, cell-based assays or similar techniques- Excellent written and verbal communication skills- Previous experience of working as part of a team, as well as under supervision- A genuine enthusiasm for science and desire for career progressionApply to VRS today to be considered for this exciting new role!Key words: Enzyme immunoassay, ELISA, Gyrolab, MSD, Mesoscale Discovery, Singulex Erenna, radioimmunoassay, AlphaLISA, DELFIA, pharmacokinetic analysis, flow cytometry, mass spectrometry, immunogenicity testing, biomarker quantification, assay automation, cell-based assays, molecular biology, qPCR, western blotting, electrophoresis, DNA sequencing, GLP, Good Laboratory Practice, GCP, Good Clinical Practice, LIMS, industrial lab, Cambridge, Cambridgeshire, VRS5506LC

Sewerage OperatorClosing date:18/06/2017Reference:REQ001667Department:OperationsLocation:Avon and WiltshireStarting salary:Skills Matrix Grade C £22,047 - 29,010Category:PermanentPackage:45 hours, Defined contribution pension schemeJob description:Do you like working outdoors? Are you looking for a role that offers great development opportunities? If so, we may have a perfect opportunity for you.Wessex Water is the top performing water and sewerage company in the UK, serving 2.8 million customers across the south west of England. It is part of the Wessex Water Group, which comprises a number of other companies, alongside our regulated business, including engineering and construction, property development and waste management and renewable energy services.As a sewerage operator you will be part of a team working to maintain our sewerage network to meet quality and customer service standards in accordance with the waste water procedures and work instructions. You will work with customers to resolve incidents and will be responsible for accurately collating and submitting feedback information from site, such as incident forms. You will be responsible for your own health and safety as well as that of your team and any contractors, customers and general public around you. This role involves routine maintenance as well as reactive work and because we provide a 24 hour service this will include stand-by arrangements.Ideally you will already hold or be willing to undertake an NVQ level 2 in sewerage operations. You will be competent to operate a single man jetting unit and CCTV equipment and also be confined space working certified or be able to be trained to undertake this work. Streetworks certification for working in the highway would also be advantageous. Other skills include basic IT knowledge, PC literate and customer focus. Possession of a valid driving licence category B + E is also essential. You will also be able to work in pressurised environments at all times 45 hours per week.In return we offer a range of benefits including: Defined contribution pension scheme.Financial and development support for further relevant qualifications.Qualification linked pay increments.24 days holiday rising to 28 with length of service.Childcare vouchers.Cycle2Work scheme.Discounts and cashback scheme from more than 1,200 high street and online suppliers.Sound interesting? Please apply by clicking APPLY below quoting job reference REQ001667. The closing date is 18th June 2017.Please remember you must be able to prove your eligibility to work in the UK and provide evidence of qualifications gained. All offers of employment will be subject to a Basic Disclosure Criminal Records check


Contact: Recruitment Team

title: Graduate Project Associate
description:
Company description:Our growing workforce is comprised of over 13,000 employees spanning more than 13 time zones across six continents, who speak more than 30 languages-yet operate in unison as one worldwide PRA community. We provide a culture in which our employees can enjoy personal satisfaction and professional achievement and have the ability to strategically map out long-term career plans. We are committed to providing you with the tools and resources necessary as you consider a career with PRA.Job description:PRA is looking for the next generation of professionals to join their growing Project Administration team in the UK!Project Associates help drive our projects in a consistent and effective way by maximizing the support to the project leads.You will be a recent graduate with an interest in business, project support and the clinical research industry, hoping to secure a role within an award-winning company. You will be passionate about making a difference to our business.To be successful in this role you will be extremely customer focused with a real 'can-do' attitude, have a keen eye for detail and be extremely PC literate (advanced Microsoft Office skills are essential - particularly Microsoft Excel). We are looking for self-motivated applicants who have exceptional inter-personal skills, and have the ability to learn new tasks and processes quickly in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will be tenacious, have high standards of quality with a keen eye for detail and the ability to prioritise and multi task. If you have the qualities we're looking for and like what you've read please get in touch to find out more! Required profile:Essential requirements:•Graduates in any discipline who have completed their first degree or MSc in 2016 or 2017•Fluency in English is required.•The position is office based in Swansea, UK.•Start Dates: Summer 2017PRA Health Sciences is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace.What we offer:Together with a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive range of benefits and an excellent working environment.

Materials Scientist – Epoxide / Cyanate Esters / Thick FilmA leading provider of electronic mission critical systems to the defence, aerospace government, industrial and commercial sectors of industry are now looking for an experienced Material Scientist to join their engineering department.Reporting into the Engineering & Technology Manager, the successful individual will responsible for leading their high tech development team for all thick film materials and processes for customer funded projects; research, identify and develop new material sets / processes from concept to qualification; solving complex problems on new and existing products as well as characterise material systems for thick film, epoxy and solders for attach and bondability and to perform over a wide temperature range.Individuals must be qualified to at least a 2:1 in Material Science, Chemistry or Metallurgy and can demonstrate at least 12 months commercial experience of material selection, testing and risk assessment for thick film materials technology and manufacture, specifically Epoxy resins and Cyanate Esters materials, Hybrid pastes, Passive Component pastes for high current / temperature applications.Suitable individuals must also have an understanding of components used within analogue / digital design and be familiar with SolidWorks CAD and Pantheon PCB layout software.Our client is offering a salary in the region of £28,000 - £30,000 + re-location package + contributory pension scheme + 25 days holiday and private medical. Individuals must be capable of obtaining UK security clearance to SC level and therefore must have lived and worked in the UK permanently for the past 5 years.This is a fantastic opportunity to join an organisation who is at the forefront of technology, enjoying consistent growth and large investment by the USA.

Engineering Project ManagerDublin North Job PurposeReporting to the Engineering Manager, the successful candidate will be primarily responsible for leading a project group to deliver the Capital Investment Program for Pharmaceutical Processes, Packaging and Facilities within the FDA and HPRA approved facility. This role will require the leading of diverse and multi-disciplinary site project teams to achieve challenging project goals to the defined EHS standards, cost, schedule and quality requirements of the client. Current significant site projects include a building extension, development of a high containment manufacturing suite, serialisation of packaging lines and implementation of a barcode system in the site warehouse, along with specific equipment and energy related projects.The role of the Manager, Projects will primarily involve but is not limited to the following duties and responsibilities;Responsibilities including:Project Management of all Plant Capex projectsCompiling, Costing and Control of Annual Capex budgetManagement and oversight of site based Project Engineers and Contract Engineers and development of same to ensure a well motivated teamParticipate in strategic planning of future site investmentsReporting on status of Capex programEnsuring that all EHS needs are included from the start of every project and are integral to the working way of the Projects GroupTechnical Lead on relevant ProjectsLeading the Design, Procurement and completion to FAT stage on equipment projects in order to hand over to QA Validation under the site change control system.Ensure Projects are handed over in a controlled manner with manuals, training, maintenance systems and site master drawings updatedCollaborate significantly with internal/external functions and suppliers to finalize process and equipment design.Working closely with the Maintenance, Facilities, Automation Control and EHS functions to ensure the goals of the Engineering Dept. and the company are met The Person/RequirementsThe successful candidate must possess the following qualifications, skills, experiences and personal attributes.A honours degree in EngineeringAt least 7 years’ experience as a Project Lead within a regulated Pharmaceutical manufacturing environment.Excellent time management skills with ability to prioritise and work to strict deadlines.Excellent interpersonal, presentation and communications skills coupled with the ability to effectively lead cross-functional teams.A proven track record in managing projects in an oral solid dose manufacturing and packaging environment with experience in automated systems to support the manufacturing function.Although not essential, it would be highly desirable and advantageous for the candidate to possess previous experience in working and managing projects within a High Containment Manufacturing and Packaging Environment


Contact: Conor O'Neill

description:
Title: Senior Mechanical Engineer Job Type: ContractSalary: Junior role: £25-£35K, senior role up to £65KLocation: Loughborough, Leicestershire JOB DESCRIPTIONOne of our Clients is currently looking to recruit a Senior Mechanical Engineer, for a 1 year fixed term contract (leading to permanent) working for their rapidly expanding, technology leading, medical devices company based in Leicestershire.The Senior Mechanical Engineer will be involved with hands-on product development and design of complex mechanical or electro-mechanical systems and devices. You will contribute to multi-disciplinary projects in teams of Scientists, Chemists, Pharmacists, Engineers and Designers.As a Senior Mechanical Engineer you will provide detailed technical input into the mechanical, and electro-mechanical device development effort to meet the requirements of the projects as well as providing creative solutions to problems.The Senior mechanical Engineer role may also include using your technical expertise to liaise with service providers to assess and evaluate their contribution.Key Responsibilities:Key Results Areas:Support R&D device development activities for Diagnostic devices and drug delivery injectorsProvide input to the Injectable Device Technologies, for sterilesSupport Diagnostic Device Development activitiesParticipate in relationships with contract design houses, contract manufacturing companies and specialist test houses.Areas of impact affecting the job:Develop mechanical designs to realise technical solutionsGenerate mathematical models of mechanical and fluidic systemsTolerance analysis of system designsWrite technical reports and produce high quality design documentationIdentify improvements and adaptations to existing devicesFacilitate, support and/or project manage the development, verification and validation of device prototypesContribute to the product/service innovation process and generate intellectual propertyCompile documentation including Technical File, in accordance with relevant regulatory requirementsKey SkillsExperience:Around 10 years experience in a similar roleGraduate in Mechanical EngineeringSignificant track record in development of Medical DevicesKnowledge:Product development from concept to commercialisationDesign for development and manufacture - function and assemblyMedical and Diagnostic Device development and manufacturing processesMedical device and drug/device combination regulatory requirements; ISO13485 and medical devices directivesSterile product development knowledgeRef. code: MecEngNmra

title: Graduate Technical Sales Executive (GTSE)
description:
Rakem, based in Bury, was founded in 1996 and is an agent and distributor for manufacturers who supply speciality raw material to the paper, coating, plastics, textile fibres, pharmaceutical and chemical industries.We are looking for proactive, self -motivated, enthusiastic individuals who want to join a £12 million chemical distributor as part of their expanding Sales team.Graduate Technical Sales Executive (GTSE)As a member of the Rakem Sales Team, the Graduate Sales Executive will manage and develop existing and new business customers in the UK. The GTSE will be required to have a full knowledge of the products Rakem offer and their customer’s processes and manufactured products. He/She will also have direct contact with the suppliers of raw materials to Rakem (known as Principals).The job holder will need to maintain current sales levels for their defined customers as well as increasing the current sales level by selling more products to existing customers and finding new customers with a need for the products in the Rakem range.The GTSE will be required to visit customer sites regularly, ensuring sales reports/monthly reports are written and submitted timely post-visit; attending trade shows as well as participating in electronic communication and social networking in support of the Rakem sales objectives. He/She will also be required to support continual improvement and education of product knowledge by attending product and sales training. Applicants must have a BSc or above in chemistry or a life science discipline. They must be computer literate in particular with MS Office including Word, Excel and PowerPoint; self-motivated, organised and proactive. Effective interpersonal skills including communication both verbal and written are essential. Candidates must be confident in adapting style and sales approach to suit a variety of different situations and customers, in support of the Rakem brand. The GTSE will need to have the ability to obtain a solid grasp of mathematical concepts, basic statistics as well as fully understanding the chemistry behind the Rakem products. The role is full time and possession of a driving license is essential as the role is field based. (The job holder will work from the offices in Bury when not visiting customers/principals etc.).An attractive salary of £22,000 per annum with a company car and benefits package is on offer for the successful candidate. If you are interested in a rewarding career with a progressive company, please send a full CV and covering letter detailing your salary expectations by email. The closing date for this opportunity will be Wednesday 21st June. 


Contact: Rebecca .
        

Reference: Totaljobs/GTSE0517

title: QA Operations Associate
description:
Catalent require a QA Operations Associate at our Dartford manufacturing facility.As the successful candidate you will be responsible for adherence and management of quality systems mainly related to product quality in line with GMP’s and current standard as part of the overall QMS within Catalent Micron Technologies Ltd.The successful candidate will be a QA professional and have QA experience in batch reviewand working in an API /Drug product manufacturing site and GMP environment.Role Description:·To be responsible for the individual batch record review and release by supervising the activity of pre-contract review (SOW) and the review of manufacturing and QC test data.·To support operations in inspecting equipment, releasing equipment’s, releasing incoming materials, reviewing data and generally any support task that Operations require to continue Production·To ensure, together with QMS Manager that procedures and processes are followed in line with Catalent Micron Technologies Ltd.’s Quality Manual.·To ensure that the services provided meet all regulatory requirements and also client quality technical agreements.·To support, assure and advice New Product Introduction into the facility in line with cGMP’s requirements.·To safeguard the quality of materials and data handled or processed in accordance with regulatory and cGMPs requirements.·Ensure all facilities, systems, equipment, operations and data etc. are all time validated in accordance with GMP standards·To conduct investigations relative to complaint, liaise with the customer, participate in the CAPA implementation·To conduct investigations relative to a deviation and OOS and identification of appropriate CAPAs.·To assure trending and management of complaints, deviations, CAPAs and other metrics affecting product quality when required.·To support completion of the internal auditWhy Work for Us:Our Vision is to be the world’s most trusted, reliable and innovative drug development and deliverypartner by upholding the highest industry standards and exceeding customer expectations, while drivingstrong, sustained growth for the company. Competitive salary package + Healthcare + Dental Plan + Contributory Pension About Catalent:Catalyst + Talent. Our name combines these ideas. From drug and biologic development services, to delivery technologies to supply solutions, our highly skilled and dedicated global team of over 9,500 is passionate about improving health and wellness by combining their personal expertise and advanced technologies to advance science and supply products of the highest quality to customers and patients around the world. Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career! Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help develop some of the nearly 200 products we launch each year or help supply over 7,000 products for patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where our professionals work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market, for the benefit of patients globally. Our MISSION is to develop, manufacture and supply products that help people live better, healthier lives. OUR VALUES are at the foundation of everything we do: ·Patient First: We put patients at the centre of our work to ensure the safety, reliable supply and optimal performance of our products. ·Customer Dedication: We strive to exceed our customers’ expectations every day. ·People: We are committed to the growth, development and engagement of our people. ·Innovation: We develop and apply innovative solutions, superior technologies and continuously improved processes. ·Integrity: We demonstrate respect, accountability and honesty in every interaction. ·Excellence: We have a passion for excellence in everything we do. Catalent. More products. Better treatments. Reliably supplied.™ Visit www.catalent.com/careers to explore career opportunities.


Contact: James Nutt
        

Reference: Totaljobs/0022346
        

Job ID: 74212589

title: Pet Insurance Claims Handler
description:
Due to continued growth within this prestigious company located on Kings Hill, we are searching for a number of additional Pet Insurance Claims Handlers, to complement the team.Working within the professional Pet Insurance Claims Team, there is some flexibility in terms of the ideal candidate, but it is considered ideal for an individual who has either:-- perhaps started a veterinary nursing qualification, but who has decided not to complete it- a newly qualified Veterinary Nurse who has decided not to pursue their career as a Vet Nurse- an individual who has worked within a vet practice and picked up the claims handling experience, including familiarity with general veterinary terminology- an individual already working within a Pet Claims setting perhaps looking for that next step in their career (a more senior role is also available, if you feel ready to perhaps embrace that next step)Ultimately, you will become a competent Pet Insurance Claims Handler, with on the job training and support provided, all within a friendly and professional team. These are NON SALES roles!You will be handling incoming calls from the general public relating to their Pet Insurance claim, gathering any necessary information required in an efficient and timely manner, updating the system records to accurately and clearly reflect the claims journey and keeping the customer informed at all times, in accordance with the principals of Treating Customers Fairly, or as you would wish to be treated.Additional skills we are seeking: Excellent written and verbal communication skillsThe ability to prioritise workloads and work to deadlinesOutstanding interpersonal skillsRespect for business and customer confidentialityOrganised and methodicalPrevious experience gained within a friendly contact centre setting could be helpfulThe ability to deliver in terms of exceptional levels of customer serviceApplicants must be educated to a minimum GCSE standard or equivalent.Attractive salary available, depending on your level of experience but £19K - £22K Our client offers exceptional working conditions.Please email your CV as a Word document asap.

title: Laboratory Technician
description:
Job Specification  For: Lab Technician Location: Wrexham Hours: 4 on 4 off rota basis (12 hour shifts) Salary: GBP19,000 + 33% shift allowance  Ref: VR/00299  A superb opportunity has arisen for a hardworking and ambitious individual to join our clients team. You will be working for a well-established company based in Wrexham, North Wales. The successful candidate will hold a key role in a forward-thinking team of dedicated individuals. Our client is looking for energetic individual with enthusiasm and a can-do attitude.  Job Description:  You will be joining a busy team within a growing business with a friendly and refreshing culture, where you'll be encouraged and supported to further develop your skills and knowledge · To provide business with analytic and microbiological service to support the operational function in achieving right first time quality · Collect the check weigh statistics from the factory floor and to collate and monitor weights · Perform all testing of samples as required · To sort retained samples for the hot room for micro testing daily. Dispose of samples at the end of testing · Sample raw materials for micro testing · Water testing · Swabbing of all factory machines · Weekly calibration of balances both in the laboratories and on the factory floor · Monitor and log temperatures of all incubators, autoclaves and fridges · High Working Standards, Quality and Attention to Detail.  Candidate Profile:  · Thoroughly professional at all times, especially when dealing with customers · Experience and understanding of GMP. · Good team-worker prepared to help others in all areas of the business. · Capable of detailed examination of information to ensure its accuracy · Adequate background knowledge of micro · Knowledge and experience of organoleptic techniques. · Sound understanding of HACCP and Food Safety principles, ideally to at least intermediate level  For more information please call Exectec Liverpool 0151 347 4900 or email your CV to   Compiled by : Charlotte Duffy Compiled on : 05/24/17

Quality EngineerEdinburghBBI Solutions is a leading expert in immunoassay development and manufacturing services, and provides an extensive portfolio of products and technologies to the global diagnostic market. Our portfolio includes the Novarum reader; a powerful software tool that lets you read and share the results of diagnostic assays (including lateral flow tests) using nothing more than a smartphone.As a business, we are currently embarking on a period of substantial growth and investment, which has led to the requirement to recruit additional talent to the business. This includes the opportunity to recruit a Quality Engineer into our growing Novarum team.The RoleAs the Quality Engineer, you will lead on Quality Assurance activities of the business processes. You will work with the team to ensure compliance of design and development activities as well as all other business areas addressed by the QMS.Key duties and responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following:Schedule and conduct internal audits, and supplier evaluationLiaise and support external and regulatory auditsEnsure that processes needed for the Quality Management System (QMS) are established and maintainedWork with team to ensure complianceReport on the performance of the QMS; participate in quality management reviewsInvestigate Complaints arising from customer Service deskParticipate in project reviews to ensure appropriate design controls are being metPromote awareness of quality and regulatory requirementsSupport validation activitiesThe PersonAs the Quality Engineer, you will be somebody who is able to work unsupervised and communicate effectively with your team, pears and customers.You will be somebody who is competent with software tools for reporting, and the use of cloud based systems and you will ideally hold the following Qualifications and experience:Internal Auditor Training to ISO 13485Significant Experience in a similar roleExperience of working with medical devices / IVD through the development lifecycleExperience of complaints handling and CAPA processExperience in Process Validation.Physical Sciences to Degree LevelIt will be key that you can apply your compliance knowledge to software, it’s development and lifecycle.The CompanyBBI is a fast-paced and agile business, with a track record of growth, and the opportunity to influence and direct the business going forward. We deliver exceptional products and technologies that people rely on to enjoy a better quality of life. We look for our people to be active participants in BBI life, to make work fun as well as challenging.

title: Senior HPLC/LC-MS Protein Scientists
description:
Exiting opportunities to join a world renowned laboratory in the North West!Are you an accomplished scientist with over 3 years’ experience in large molecule analyses? Do you have experience in a regulated laboratory? Are you proficient in using LCMS and/or HPLC? If so, this could be the role for you! Working in a dynamic and hard-working team you will be responsible for large molecule quantification/qualification using an impressive suite of HPLC/LC-MS instrumentation. You will utilise your expertise in biological sample preparation, method development & validation, as well as mentoring of junior staff. The successful applicants must have:·A minimum of 3 years’ experience analysing proteins using HPLC and/or LC-MS·Experience developing and validating novel methods ·Experience working in a regulated industry laboratory (GxP)Apply to VRS now for this incredible opportunity!Key Words: LCMS, LC-MS, LC/MS, LC/LC-MS, Protein, Characterisation, Peptide, Oligonucleotides, Biochemistry, Biological, Chemistry, Analytical, Manchester, North West, VRS5504AF

Animal Support Technician (Animal Care) BLUA49472Ledbury, HerefordshireCompetitive SalaryOur Client has an outstanding reputation for quality in the field of preclinical contract research. They can offer a busy, varied and technically challenging working environment, where they are committed to offering the best training and development.The main role of the Support Technician is the conduct of husbandry procedures for all species, e.g. feeding, watering, bedding and cage changing in all species. Other duties would include routine cleaning of the animal rooms and equipment and assisting experienced Animal Technologists with technical procedures. The Support Technician, depending upon ability, may also be trained in many other tasks.The animal technicians work within small teams, sometimes working on their own for periods of time and they do require flexibility in working hours since they organise the working day around study requirements. You must be prepared to be on the weekend work rota. Ideally you will have previous experience of working with animals before. It is also desirable if you hold an animal related scientific qualification. As a long standing Bronze Investors in People organisation and having won a Commitment to Training award this year, our Client is confident that they can offer a varied role with a clear progression path, together with a good range of company benefits.This is a Blue Octopus Recruitment Ltd vacancy who are operating as an employment agency. title: Occupational Safety Hygiene Consultant & Trainee Positions
description:
The Company:Euro Environmental are market leaders in providing specialist occupational health and safety, offering services throughout the UK. The company has an ambitious plan to grow over the next 3 years and is looking for dedicated trainee and /or qualified technical staff to join our team of occupational safety hygiene specialists. Purpose of the Role / Duties:The successful candidate will undergo training primarily in the field of workplace exposure and indoor air quality assessments, additional training shall be given in the field of workplace noise.The role will involve attending client sites throughout the South of England & London area to conduct various testing activities and issue test reports on behalf of Euro Environmental Ltd.The post holder will be required to undergo internal and external training and qualifications relevant to the position via a specialist training program which will include training by the British Occupational Hygiene Society.Specific duties include:Taking part in all internal / external training activities and courses.Attending sites throughout the UK to witness test activities as part of training schemes.Attending site to conduct tests and assessments on behalf of the company once trained.Technical activities shall include:Conducting indoor air quality assessmentsWorkplace exposure assessments.Workplace noise exposure testing.Providing data and samples for analysis to the branch office when requiredProviding progress reports to the office / line manager in line with company procedures.Working to company KPI’s.Who We’re Looking For:The successful candidate should have a professional outlook and willingness to learn, be of smart appearance with ambition to progress within the field of occupational hygiene and safety, they must have an adaptive approach to their work environment as travel and staying away will be a requirement. The candidate must be computer literate, self motivated and reliable with good organisational & planning skills and be able to demonstrate a flexible approach to work.Candidates should posses higher education qualifications preferably in a science based discipline.Other Details:The role is based on core hours of 37.5 hrs per weekThe position will be home-based or based at our southern office in Stevenage, with travel to client sites.The role includes a company car or car allowance.Want to know more about what a career in occupational hygiene is like? please click on the video link below:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eMKlg5fNz8s&list=PLzB7dZx9sR5hmUtJlgVWWfSaohsYOe9FH&index=4Application Instructions:All interested applicants should apply by submitting your CV and cover letter summarising why they would be suitable for the position.

title: Molecular Microbiology Research Assistant / Scientist
description:
We are currently looking for a Molecular Microbiology Research Assistant / Scientist to join an emerging Biotechnology company based in the Cambridgeshire area. As the Molecular Microbiology Research Assistant / Scientist you will assist in the designing of novel live bacterial biotherapeutics. You will focus on microbiology and molecular biology techniques including; microbial culturing and characterisation, nucleic acid isolation, PCR and real-time PCR. KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Your duties as the Molecular Microbiology Research Assistant / Scientist will be varied however the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:1. The growing and archiving of therapeutic bacteria, in a new state-of-the-art microbial culturing facility.2. Culturing of gastrointestinal microbes.3. Characterisation of microbes through molecular biology techniques such as PCR.4. Play a key role in building a new biotech company and to contribute to the development of a new class of biotherapeutics.ROLE REQUIREMENTS:To be successful in your application to this exciting opportunity as the Molecular Microbiology Research Assistant / Scientist we are looking to identify the following on your profile and past history:1. Relevant degree in a Life Sciences discipline (e.g. Microbiology, Molecular Biology or something similar).2. Proven industry experience assisting in a microbiology or molecular biology laboratory.3. A working knowledge and practical experience with Bacterial Cell culture, DNA/RNA extraction and PCR techniques.Key Words: Molecular Biology | Microbiology | Bacterial Cell Culture | DNA Extraction | RNA Extraction | PCR | RT-PCR | Research and Development Hyper Recruitment Solutions Ltd (HRS) is an Equal Opportunities employer who are certified by Investors in People for our talent development. We welcome applications for any applicant who fulfil the role requirements for this position. HRS is a company exclusively supporting the science and technology sectors, and is made up of a collaboration of recruitment processionals and scientists. We look forward to helping you with your next career moves.



Contact: Georgia Walden

description:

title: Device Development Engineer
description:
Job Purpose:PragmatIC is seeking a highly motivated device development engineer to work within its expanding R&D team. The successful candidate will focus on carrying-out device fabrication, electrical testing, developing processes and designing experiments for materials integration. The candidate should have a good understanding and some experience of the fabrication and evaluation of micro-electronics and/or MEMS.Key functional responsibilities:·Develop devices and experiments to investigate functional layers. ·Perform complex and critical experimental work, encompassing detailed process flows, device fabrication, inspecting devices through the fabrication process, testing, analysis and interpretation of device electrical performance, refinement of process, review with colleagues and project partners and planning of further series of trials.·Prepare technical reports and presentations summarising experimental procedure and trial outcomes.Technical Specification:Essential:·Photolithography, including the operation of mask aligners or similar tools.·Thin film deposition techniques such as sputtering, evaporation, CVD, ALD.·Wet- and dry-etching of thin films.·Inspection methods e.g. surface profilometry, microscopy, ellipsometry.·Nano-scale inspection methods such as AFM, SEM, TEM.·Electrical testing e.g. IV, CV, hall mobility measurement·Interpretation of the electrical test data arising from micro-electronic devices.Person Specification:Essential:·A degree (or equivalent experience) in electronic engineering, physics, chemistry or materials science.·A track record of innovation and problem-solving in the field of micro- and nano-fabrication·Good computer literacy skills including documents, spreadsheets, databases and presentations.·A practical “hands-on” approach to problem solving.·A critical, questioning approach to the analysis of complex trial data.·Ability to work well with team members, industrial project partners and customers.Desirable:·Detailed knowledge of micro- or nano-scale device construction techniques – for example photolithography, physical vapour deposition, ALD, plasma ash & etch.·Good knowledge of the measurement and inspection skill associated with fabrication and thin film processing – for instance AFM, ellipsometry, SEM, surface profilometry

title: Forensic Laboratory Assistant
description:
Our client is looking for a Forensic Laboratory Assistant to join their team in Malvern. The main purpose of this role is to receive, unpack and book in and record delivery of forensic submissions, using MS Access database for specimen receipt. You will be responsible for inputting analytical results and case workloads, ready to be submitted to the laboratory for analysis by the next working day.Duties and Responsibilities:To ensure that all samples are handled according to current Standard Operating Procedures and to a strict Chain of Custody, providing all relevant sample information to the rest of the companyTo follow Health and Safety guidelines maintaining the accessioning and reception areas (inside and out) in a safe and tidy conditionTo maintain and produce laboratory reagents, solvents, standardsTo perform general Laboratory cleaning and housekeeping, including cleaning and maintenance of laboratory equipment and maintaining levels of stock items and informing senior staff for orderingTo transfer, store and manage the administration of case material (e.g. biological fluids including post-mortem blood, urine, tissues)Confidential handling of medico-legal reportsThe successfully appointed Forensic Laboratory Assistant should be able to deal with confidential information and should have the ability to communicate clearly and effectively. They will be required to follow instructions and pay attention to detail with minimal error as well as be able to work well even under pressure and in a busy environment. This team requires flexibility and sharing of the workload to achieve daily targets.Key Skills and Experience Required:Well organised, efficient and pleasant mannerBe able to communicate effectivelyHave good IT skills, be able to use a computer for databases and case administrationBe able to work independently and part of a teamBe open to performing new tasksWork accurately, precisely and carefullyBe able to prioritise tasksHow to ApplyIf you have the skills for this Forensic Laboratory Assistant role then please click apply and follow a short application

description:
Do you have the skills and analytical expertise to work as a Development Chemist within this internationally successful company? This world market leader in high vacuum technology for the semi-conductor industries is currently seeking to recruit a Development Chemist with strong analytical skills to join a small team who will be autonomously designing, building and operating experiments in support of this company’s market leading technology.     Key skills/Knowledge required: •	Degree or PhD in chemistry or related field.•	Experience in the field of semi-conductor process tool development or operation.•	Knowledge of the effects of gases with different materials (combustion/incineration)•	Ability to operate, build and conduct safety reviews and experiments within an industrial lab environment. These Development Chemist jobs are a fantastic opportunity to join a successful and fast growing organisation who can offer dynamic, challenging and exciting career opportunities. Based at their site in Somerset and like all jobs on this client’s site it is commutable from Bristol, Avon, Clevedon, South Wales, Gloucestershire and Taunton. For more information on this Development Chemist Job based in Clevedon or to discuss similar jobs throughout the UK , please call Dannielle Dickens at Redline Group on 01582 878831 or email DDickens@Redlinegroup.Com regarding such jobs with an up to date C.V and covering letter.  Key words for this job and similar jobs: Development, Chemist, Chemists, analytical, PhD, semi-conductor, gases, experimental jobs.     Visit and follow Redline GroupTwitter:@redlinegroupuk LinkedIn:www.linkedin.com/company/redline-group-ltd

title: Contracts Manager
description:
New position for a Commercial Contracts Manager  Your new company  An award winning & progressive company within the pharmaceutical sector   Your new role  This role is for a Commercial Contracts Manager. It's a new role within this forward thinking company and to support the business in the preparation, negotiation, and completion of contractual arrangements. Responsibilities will include: * Drawing up and facilitating the design of robust commercial agreements. This will include letters of intent, contracts, master service agreements, confidentiality agreements and amendments to contracts. * Providing advice & guidance to colleagues about client contracts. * Input to commercial pricing * Monitor & report on contract performance and life cycle. * Develop initiatives to ensure improvement within Contracts Management activities.     What you'll need to succeed   * Practical understanding of commercial contract development, IP processes, SLA's, SOP's & service provision, ideally gained within a regulated sector.  * The ability to develop and build strong working relationships using stakeholder management skills.  * Ability to demonstrate commercial acumen gained in a complex, multi-client environment. * High levels of report writing & data analysis skills.  * Experience of working within the pharmaceutical sector would be advantageous but not essential.    What you'll get in return   * An excellent opportunity to progress your career within a leading organisation that places its people at the heart of its business. * A competitive salary of up tp £40,000 * Performance bonus * Generous pension scheme * Private health care   What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. title: Regulatory Affairs Associate
description:
ROLE: REGULATORY AFFAIRS ASSOCIATEPAY RATE: £12.00/H LOCATION: REIGATEDURATION: Initially until the 31st Dec 17Are you a team player with strong interpersonal and communication skills?Are you a recent graduate in Chemistry looking for the first step in your career? If so, you don't have to look further as Kelly Services as a fantastic opportunity for a Regulatory Affairs Associate with a strong chemistry background to join a multinational company, leader in the personal care industry with a global presence in the market.Your new role You will be responsible for the acquisition, database management and reporting of information relating to product and raw material chemical safety, technical, product stewardship and regulatory compliance. You will be reporting to the Associate Director, Global Regulatory Affairs. You will be working independently to obtain data from internal customers and external vendors, to evaluate and manage this data within the SAP EHS environment and to provide reports from SAP. You will provide support to both KCP and Consumer businesses with a focus on the Asia Pacific region. What you will need to succeedYou will need to have a good recent bachelor's degree in chemistry with demonstrated proficiency in database management with good attention to details. Ideally, you will have ability to work with structured database systems such as SAP, Oracle, Access and also proficiency in applications such as Excel, Word,Visio, Powerpoint and Sharepoint. Knowledge of chemical safety regulations preferred. What you will get in return Along with an attractive hourly pay rate of £12.00, you will have the opportunity to join a global company leader in the personal care industry. You will be based in a modern and spacious building and be part of a great multicultural environment. What you need to do nowIf this sounds like the right position for you, and you are available to start work immediately simply apply online! If you have any further questions please call Laura on 0203 040 1900.Kelly Services are an Equal Opportunities employer for all jobs, and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.Kelly Services are acting as an Employment Business in relation to these jobs.#chemistry # safety #regulatory affairs

description:
Associate dentist in Chesterfield (S44) | Oasis Healthcare Ltd - totaljobs

        Associate Dentist
        








Chesterfield (S44), 






Excellent earnings and established private list












Permanent


Today



























Associate Dentist Bolsover. Full time, up to 6300 UDAs plus established private list. A little bit about usWe’re sure you know Oasis as the fastest growing dental corporate with nearly 400 practices. Equally, we guess there’s probably lots you don’t know about us.So forget what you think you know. At Oasis we like to think we are different, setting the bar high, having developed excellent standards over the past 20 years and confidently 100% CQC compliant. It’s our mission to put our patients at the heart of everything that we do and our people approach is founded on respect and engagement. It’s for this reason we find it easy to provide fantastic benefits to our Associate Dentists, given they are instrumental partners in this business. We have our heart set on offering a great place to work, and whilst the Oasis name is above the door, each practice is unique and has a family feel and sense of community.You’ll love our approach to the appointment book as we recognise that Associate Dentists typically want a balance between NHS and private work and a realistic contract allocation. Then here’s the other corporate myth we want to put to one side. Our Associate Dentists have access to the materials and equipment that they need to offer the best level of patient care (we supply 4000 material items and digital x-rays in every practice).We know it is important to feel supported, through both the ups and the downs. Our Associate Dentists know they can rely on the support of an experienced clinical team and in-house medico-legal advice.A little bit about the practice and the roleWe are looking for an Associate Dentist to work Full time to complete up to 6300 UDAs per annum (we can discuss the right allocation for your experience level). We also welcome part-time enquiries for a pro-rata contract allocation.For this Associate Dentist role we are offering an excellent UDA rate and 50/50 shared lab costs. We also appreciate changing jobs is tricky so we will extend a special welcome payment (call to find out more).We feel certain you will like the practice as it will provide:·A modern, well furbished environment with 6 surgeries. ·Digital x-ray processing·Free and accessible parking. ·An established Practice Manager, Becky, who has worked with the practice for 14 years. ·Experienced nurses, some trained by our in-house Nurse Academy.We are located in a local village, with the beautiful surroundings of Bolsover Castle and the Derbyshire countryside. A lively village with pubs, restaurants and a shopping precinct. However, we are only a few minutes from the M1, which gives you an easy link to Nottingham - 45 minutes and Sheffield - 30 minutes. Also with only being a 20 minute drive from the Chesterfield Town Centre, it means easy access for all walks of life. And let’s get to those added benefitsYou will be part of a community that benefits from an insurance based indemnity bespoke to Oasis, extensive marketing national and local, discounted CPD, sponsored education including MSc, access to career relevant and subsidised training programmes. These benefits are available from your very first day and you can expect a comprehensive induction.What’s not to love about all of that? We hope you are inspired by our Associate Dentist opportunity in Bolsover and to join this fantastic team. If you want to know more about the Oasis approach, we think you will enjoy this short film: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TMDWxBnYNdE&t=1sIs your heart in the right place?


Contact: Stacey Hunt
        

Reference: Totaljobs/SH_Bols

title: Lab Technician
description:
LOCATION: SkegnessJOB TITLE: Lab TechnicianSALARY & BENEFITS: £16,000 – £18,000 pa - depending on experienceWORKING HOURS: Monday to Friday, 9.00am – 5.00pm (30 mins lunch) - THE COMPANY: We are pleased to be working with a very well established company that has been providing critical garment services within the UK for over 30 years, but has been established for over 100 years starting as a steam laundry. The company is a market leader in the provision of clean garments to the food processing and manufacturing industries, and also offers consumables and PPE services, and they are a large supplier to the pharmaceuticals industry.THE ROLE: The role involves taking responsibility for activities in the laboratory including routine/ad-hoc testing and laboratory administration. You will provide laboratory testing to support product, service, process, and technology development projects with the aim of adding value and quality in order to enhance sales opportunities, streamline processes and exceed customer expectations.Key Duties:• Administer, undertake and manage laboratory testing, including microbiological, chemical and physical tests.• Undertake routine and non-routine testing associated with process or product validation, investigations and other research and development activities.• Interpret and act upon routine test results, including investigation and resolution where appropriate.• Maintain full, accurate and retrievable records of projects and related project management documentation.• Maintain accurate and retrievable laboratory records.• Maintain the laboratory and laboratory equipment in a clean, safe, operational condition, including arranging and carrying out calibration tests where applicable.• Administer systems covering the development and authorisation of new garment styles and wash trials, including the issuing of reports and archiving samples.• Maintain all R+D systems and records as specified in department and company SOPs.THE CANDIDATE: Ideally you will have experience or hold scientific qualifications. You must have a methodical, diligent and meticulous approach to work. Full UK driving licence is essential for this post. The ideal candidate will also have the following skills and attributes:• Scientific qualifications / experience preferred, but not essential (an undergraduate degree in chemistry, biology, microbiology or related subjects would be most appropriate)• Good IT skills in the use of Microsoft office products• Full UK driving licencePersonal attributes:• Personal drive and self-motivation• Good time management skills• Good planning and recording skills• Fluent spoken and written EnglishAre you the Lab Technician we are looking for? If yes then please hit the apply now button.You will then be sent to an online questionnaire to support your CV and application, please fill in the details and we will be in touch to advise you of the next steps.
    


Contact: Kristina Best
        

Reference: Totaljobs/TSLKB1137

description:
Head of Quality (Pharmaceuticals)
        








New Zealand, Australasia


Car, Pension, Healthcare, Profit share












Permanent


Posted 17 days ago



























Head of Quality (Pharmaceutical Intermediates & APIs)Competitive Salary + Car + Pension + Healthcare + Profit SharePermanent, Based in New ZealandDo you have significant experience within Pharmaceutical Manufacturing and Laboratory Quality Assurance?Would you like to work for a successful international company in one of the most beautiful parts of the world??My client manufactures Pharmaceutical Intermediates, APIs, Pharmaceutical Chemicals and Diagnostic products for the world's leading pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies. With the significant expansion of the manufacturing facilities in their New Zealand, they are seeking to employ a talented Head of Quality to join the Senior Management Team.The Head of Quality will ensure products conform to customer specifications and comply with national and international regulatory requirements. In addition, you will ensure the continued development of QMS to ensure continued compliance with international GMP standards for all new products and projectsThe role, reporting directly to the company General Manager, will manage the on-site Quality Assurance (QA), Quality Control (QC) and Quality Systems (QS) teams, to meet business, budget and regulatory requirements activities.Existing entitlement to live and work in NZ is not required and the company will assist in any visa applications for the successful candidate if required.The role requires someone who is able to operate on a Operational and Strategic level, managing a department of approx 20 people via 3 direct reports. You will be responsible for leading and instilling a culture of 'quality first' across the wider business. It is expected that you will have the following skills and experience;Proven industrial experience in a commercial organisation managing a busy Quality team, including effective people and financial management abilityProven experience in managing regulatory audits, the preparation and submission of regulatory dossiers and ability to ensure the site is constantly audit readyA tertiary qualification with preferably a Masters or PhD in Chemistry or equivalentA qualification in Quality Management or GMP would be an added advantageExpert communication and leadership skills with initiative and capability in decision makingYour drive for excellence and proven experience in managing and training staff together with the ability to develop and maintain a high functioning team culture will ensure that you succeed in this role.Here is your opportunity to join the senior management team of a highly successful, privately owned company that is undergoing significant growth and development.Key Words 'Quality Assurance, QA, QC, Quality Systems, Quality Control, GMP, API, Pharmaceutical, Quality Assurance Manager, QA Manager, Head of QA, Manufacturing'A competitive remuneration package is offered including a car, profit share, superannuation and medical & insurance benefits. Please apply on-line or call Neil Walton on 0203 096 4706The recruiter has stated that all applicants for this job should be able to prove they are legally entitled to work in the UK. title: Asbestos Surveyor - P402 - South East
description:
A good calibre and committed Asbestos Surveyor is being sought by one of our highly successful client within the asbestos sector in the South East and will include applications from London, Essex, Kent and the surrounding areas. Purpose of the Role:Covering various contracts, predominately commercial and housing stock and public sector.Purpose of the Role:Covering various contracts designated by the client.Qualifications & Experience:Possessing the P402 or the equivalent - RSPH qualification and have significant and varied experience working within this role and within the asbestos field is essential.Must have good communication skills, both written and verbal.Must be well-versed with the Health and Safety procedures appertaining to asbestos. Must be competent in using the Microsoft Office Package.Key Role:Carrying out asbestos Management and Refurbishment/Demolition surveys on various properties. Producing comprehensive asbestos reports as and when required.Liaising with the company's mixed portfolio of clients on a regular basis.Requirements/Attributes:In general, the post-holder will be versatile, flexible, have good work ethos and have the ability to carry out the work effectively and within time line.Must be flexible with regards travelling to sites.In return, this company offers a competitive salary, depending on expertise and set skill, fuel allowance and along with many other benefits.Future Select are the leading market supplier for recruitment in the Asbestos industry, we work with the best clients & candidates and supply the majority of permanent jobs in the asbestos market. We have a large dedicated team, with over 25 years combined industry experience within Asbestos recruitment specifically geared to dealing with Asbestos Surveyors/Analysts/Lab Technicians, Administrators, Project/Regional /Technical/Quality/Training/Sales Managers through to Director level for both Consultancy & Removal. description:

title: Senior Development Scientist
description:
Senior ScientistCardiff CF14 5DX/ Crumlin NP11 3EFBBI Solutions is a leading expert in immunoassay development and manufacturing services, and provides an extensive portfolio of products and technologies to the global diagnostic markets.We are currently progressing through a period of substantial growth as an organization, and have the opportunity to recruit a number of Senior Development Scientists into our growing operation. This role will initially be based from our Cardiff site, but will move to our brand new Global Centre of Excellence in Crumlin, by early 2018.The RoleAs the Senior Scientist, you will work within the Lateral Flow Division’s R&D team on contract and internal development projects. Responsible for planning, executing and troubleshooting of the project’s technical aspects , you will be expected to be the key technical contact for the project internally and with the Customer.Reporting to the R&D Leader / Manager the role will also involve preparation of work plans, analysis and presentation of all results using appropriate software tools for review and presentation to the customer. In addition, the role will require flexibility to work in other areas of the Lateral Flow Division for example process verification and validation activities. Your primary objectives will include, but not be limited to the following:Working on all phases of the R&D project under supervision of Development Leader / Project Manager (if not the manager).Direct scientific input and expertise on both internal and contract development projects.Coordinate project technical meetings and liaise with external customers as required. Host / Co-host customer visits and meetings.Write and present technical reports for both internal and external circulation for review by Research and Development Leader / Project Manager.Understand the requirements of working within a quality management system and work with the Project Manager / Research and Development Leader to ensure experimental work is appropriate.This is a non-exhaustive list and you will be required to perform other duties in line with the Senior Scientist remit.The PersonTo be eligible for this position, you must have significant experience of working in a laboratory environment, and a background in IVD development with a good understanding of ISO 9001 and ISO 13485. It is key that you have also had experience working specifically within an R&D environment.You will have a very strong technical background within immunoassay development and strong experimental planning and organizational skills. It will be paramount that you have the ability to coordinate a technical team as well as proven time management skills.A skilled communicator, you will have the ability to keep all contributors to the project up to date with immediate technical requirements, whilst maintaining visibility of the long-term requirements.The CompanyBBI is a fast-paced and agile business, with a track record of growth, and the opportunity to influence and direct the business going forward. We deliver exceptional products and technologies that people rely on to enjoy a better quality of life. We look for our people to be active participants in BBI life, to make work fun as well as challenging.

title: Trainee Field Engineer
description:
My client has a new position in the company which is being created to help support our planned growth. Whilst this person will initially spend most of their time in our repair shop, once trained they will be spending some of their time at customer sites. The person will take on responsibility for the calibration and maintenance where there are multiple units on a single customer site. The amount of time spent on customer sites will vary greatly from week to week and it is expected that the person will spend an increasing number of days away from home.Key Tasks (technical)Carry out calibrations, repairs and testing of Company and third party equipment at the repair shop in Cambridge.Attend sites across the United Kingdom to carry out PME and calibrations on Company and third party equipment.Attend sites across the United Kingdom to carry our repairs on Company and third party equipment.Attend meetings / training at head office or at other sites as required around the world.Allow sales and other employees to attend any site with you.Support the sales team with the generation of new business opportunities.Provide telephone / remote support to customers as required.Key Tasks (other)Organise site visits by liaising directly with customers.Complete and issue all required calibration certificates in a timely manner.Complete all paperwork properly and in a timely and manner including the required administration activities on the business systems including SAP and Coresuite. This should include the timely closing of all jobs.Respond to any Company or customer communication quickly and effectively.Review what we do and how we do it so as to remove non value adding tasks. Identify any processes or tasks that could be improved with better systems or training etc.Suggest and implement ways in which we can improve our overall customer service.Knowledge/Experience·The person must have the ability to develop into a field engineer·The person should have ability / experience of working on customer premises·The person should have experience of electro - mechanical equipment·The person should have software application experience·Previous experience of laboratory equipment is an advantage·ISO 17025 or UKAS accreditation experience would be an advantage·Knowledge or experience in temperature mapping and calibration would be an advantagePersonal SpecificationsAbility to learn how to calibrate and repair a wide range of technical equipmentAbility to break problems down into their key component partsExcellent organizational and customer skillsGood IT skillsAttention to detailThe person must be able to work on their own and be trusted to do the job effectivelyThe person must be willing to spend regular time away from homeThe person must be willing to travel long distances across the United KingdomGood spoken and written EnglishThe person should have a clean driving licenceThe person must a flexible working approachBenefits:25 days holiday per annum Pension Scheme Private Medical CoverFlexible Benefits

title: Technical Expert - Biological Chromatography
description:
We currently have an excellent opportunity available for a Technical Expert in Biological Chromatography to join a growing pharmaceutical company based in the Greater Manchester area. KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Your duties as the Technical Expert - Biological Chromatography will be varied however the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:1. The purpose of the role is to provide analytical services to customers in the pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, personal care and speciality chemical sectors in a GLP, GCP and GMP regulated laboratory. 2. You will provide specialist expertise in method development, validation of methods, CoA Testing, technical support to junior colleagues, specialising in a broad range of Biological Chromatography techniques for the analysis of a range of sample types, including, but not limited to, HPLC, UPLC and SEC-MALLS.3. You will act as the lead scientist supporting customer programmes in compliance with GxP requirements.ROLE REQUIREMENTS:To be successful in your application to this exciting opportunity as the Technical Expert - Biological Chromatography we are looking to identify the following on your profile and past history:1. B.Sc / MSc / PhD in Chemistry (or related scientific discipline).2. In-depth knowledge and hands one experience with chromatography for the analysis of biopharmaceuticals and biologics is essential. You will be expected to demonstrate experience with the development and validation of chromatography based methods including HPLC, UPLC and SEC-MALLS. You should also be able to demonstrate experience training, supervising and coordinating the work of more junior scientists. 3. Comprehensive experience of working in a GxP regulatory laboratory essential.Key Words: Technical Specialist | Technical Expert | Principal Scientist | GMP | GLP | GCP | Chemistry | Biochemistry | Biopharmaceutical | Pharmaceutical | HPLC | UPLC | SEC-MALLS | chromatographyHyper Recruitment Solutions Ltd (HRS) is an Equal Opportunities employer who are certified by Investors in People for our talent development. title: QC Manager
description:
QC, GMP, GLP, Manager Quality Control Manager  QC, Quality Control, Manager  Your new company Avara Pharmaceutical Services was founded by a team of industry veterans in 2015 and is a state of the art Contract Development and Manufacturing Organisation (CDMO).  Avara has built a global site footprint by acquiring facilities from leading pharmaceutical companies with demonstrated records for the highest quality and regulatory standards. Currently the portfolio of sites includes facilities in Arecibo, Puerto Rico; Shannon, Ireland; Norman, Oklahoma; and Avlon, United Kingdom.   The Avlon facility in the United Kingdom was acquired from AstraZeneca in December, 2016 and has approximately 220 employees. The site has developed and manufactured Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs) since 1970, and is a Worldwide Pharmaceutical Services Center of Excellence for Avara. It manufactures multiple intermediates and APIs, including rosuvastatin (Crestor®) and quetiapine (Seroquel®) for AstraZeneca   Your new role Your new job role as QC Manager will be to ensure the Quality systems are installed and maintained in accordance to GMP practices. You will also be ensuring the manufacturing of 'Plant Products,' systems and QC labs are adhering to regulatory and Avara standards. Part of this position will be to interpret GLP guidelines and regulations relating to QC activities. You will be managing a team of 23 staff and have 5 direct reports made up of QC analysts, QC IT Specialists and Senior Lab specialist.   What you'll need to succeed In order to be considered for this QC Manager position you will need the following: * Minimum of degree level or equivalent in a scientific discipline * Experience in GMP, GLP and compliance environment  * Previous management experience  * Experience of dealing with different stakeholders and working cross functionally, such as regulatory, global compliance management group and manufacturing.  Outstanding written and oral skills are needed as well as the ability to work well within a dynamic team whilst using your initiative. You will also have knowledge of Microsoft tools.   In return for this you will be given the opportunity to develop in a leading pharmaceutical company, along with a competitive salary and benefits package.   What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. 


Contact: Chandni Pankhania

description:
This client that enjoys a reputation as one of the leading consultancies in providing various professional services within all of the mainstream disciplines, including asbestos, environmental and other services across the country is actively seeking for a focused, competent, hardworking and reliable Asbestos Surveyor/Analyst in South Yorkshire and will include applications from West Yorkshire and East Yorkshire.Qualifications & Experience:The applicant must have attained the P402/P403/P404 or the equivalent - title: Reliability Engineer
description:
Reliability Engineer































Reliability Engineer (RMW184/40) Towcester, England





                    Reliability engineer required to join a global leading opto-electronics company based in Northamptonshire are seeking a Reliability engineer to join their rapidly expanding and highly-successful R&D facility. You will be working on experimental characterisation and performance investigation in laboratory / semiconductor chip teams. We are seeking an established Reliability engineer who is able to assist in the research and development for optoelectronic components and PICs (photonic integrated circuits). You will gain the opportunity to work with scientists and engineers developing state-of-the-art photonic devices and systems.  This organisation are the leading design and manufacturer of optical components for the telecommunications industry. They have sites in the UK and the US and have a £100m+ turnover. They have won multiple projects over recent years and are rapidly expanding their R&D facility in Towcester, Northamptonshire.  This Semiconductor Photonic Design Engineer / Scientist job will require the following skills / experience:•	Academically qualified to PhD level within a Physics or Electronics related discipline.•	A track record within reliability analysis for electronics•	Working with and contributing towards projects specifically centring on product reliability and assurance throughout all phases of product life-cycle including to include – packaging, mechanism, modelling, materials and processes. •	Management of FEA and FMEA. •	Conducting reliability tests and experiments to check component performance; providing reliability data and findings for reliability analysis and improvement. Skills/Knowledge required for Reliability Engineer Job include: •	Master’s degree in one of the following subjects; physics, power electronics, electrical and electronic engineering, reliability / PhD degree with at least 2-3 years direct working experience as research role.•	Ability to present data in a meaningful way that gains understanding by a diverse audience.•	Strong Experience with product life exposure – Concept through to Service operations. This is a fantastic opportunity to work on complex applications which include high-speed modulators, lasers, optics and semiconductor chips for a rapidly expanding R&D department.  To APPLY for this Reliability engineer job in Northamptonshire please send your CV to rwilcocks@redlinegroup.Com If you have any specific questions prior to applying for the job you can contact Ricky Wilcocks on 01582 878810.  Visit and follow Redline GroupTwitter:@redlinegroupuk LinkedIn:www.linkedin.com/company/redline-group-ltd

title: Supplier Business Analyst
description:
SUPPLIER BUSINESS ANALYST 
FIXED TERM CONTRACT UNTIL END DEC 2017
£50,000-£60,000 dependent on experience + package with flexible working around core hours
Located in the highly prestigious St Peter’s Square development in the city centre, Distrelec are establishing their new Enterprise Hub and hiring a Supplier Business Analyst. The Enterprise Hub will be the European home of functions that deliver the selection and purchasing of products, inventory management, collaboration with suppliers and all of their online marketing and sales websites. Distrelec, part of the Datwyler group, is a leading online distributor for electronics, automation, measurement technology, IT and accessories in Europe and the exciting new Enterprise Hub in Manchester will be its first operational presence in the UK. This is an exciting time to be joining their business. Are you up for the challenge?

The role 
In a relatively traditional industry, Distrelec are establishing an Enterprise Hub within the UK with a modern and unique approach to how they do business with their suppliers and customers. As a Supplier Business Analyst, you will support the Supplier Business Managers commercial activity to achieve optimal value extraction with vendors, as well as leading and delivering programmes to coordinate activity across the team. Your responsibilities will include vendor buy price management & optimisation , rebate tracking and delivery, POS reporting and supplier contract terms and conditions tracking. This role is critical in providing accurate information for the Supplier Business Management team, so your contribution really does count. Skills and Experience
Ideally degree educated, you will use your excellent analytical skills to evaluate performance and interpret results from both Excel and databases. Knowledge of SAP is desirable and you will ideally have experience of supplier or product management within a B2B or B2C distribution business. You will have strong financial acumen and an understanding of pricing and how it impacts business margin.
 
Benefits: 
In addition to the supportive and collaborative work environment, you can expect:


Excellent flex benefits package together with a bonus for every member of staff + pension


Flexible working around core hours


25 days holiday with option to purchase/sell additional days


Grade A offices with great transport access


Opportunity to influence the way we work


By joining the Datwyler family, you will not only enjoy the security, opportunities and benefits that come with the security of a global organisation, but also experience the excitement that a start-up business has to offer. 
Distrelec is looking for people who are solution seekers, ready to roll up their sleeves and who are motivated to get things done. Distrelec aspires to be the most dominant distributor in the electro component market by serving its customers through understanding their challenges and seeking solutions to meet their needs. 
Distrelec’s leadership believe that drive and passion are key to success. They are a customer focused company with big ambitions and an exciting journey ahead. At Distrelec, you’re empowered to make your mark. With that, comes unlimited possibilities.
This is an experience that only a few will ever get. For more information visit: 
For more information on the vacancy, or for a confidential discussion about what you are looking for, please contact Hays Procurement & Supply Chain on 0161 228 6422.

Mad Science is the world’s leading provider of science enrichment activities for children and we are currently recruiting in Berkshire.The role is part-time with the potential to become full-time for the right candidate.We pay you to have fun whilst teaching and presenting our innovative activities that show children what science is really all about.
