title: Head of Biochemistry
description:
Head of Department - BiochemistryHead of Department with veterinary laboratory experience for a leading commercial veterinary diagnostic laboratory in West YorkshireYour new company is a well-established and reputable commercial veterinary laboratory with 6 laboratory sites across England. The first UK commercial veterinary laboratory to achieve ISO 17025 UKAS accreditation, they provide over 1200 test options across the full range of clinical pathology fields. Due to business growth, they are now seeking an experienced Head of Department for their biochemistry laboratory, ideally from a veterinary pathology discipline. Key Responsibilities: You will be responsible for the management of the biochemistry department within your new company's UKAS-accredited commercial diagnostic laboratory. Reporting directly to the Laboratory Manager, you will lead and mentor a team of 3 laboratory scientists, managing their workload and providing guidance and support. You will be responsible for but not limited to:* Overseeing the running of the biochemistry laboratory* Troubleshooting and problem-solving technical issues * Training your team of scientists on technical skills* Managing QC sample testing programmes and reporting data in line with EQA schemes* Organising the maintenance of laboratory equipment* Liaising and communicating with veterinary pathologists and other laboratory departmentsRequirements for the Role:* You will be educated to degree level in a scientific degree or equivalent* You will be eligible to work in the U.K. * You will have a strong background in working within a GMP or UKAS accredited laboratory environment with GLP, with a minimum of 5 years' relevant experience in the veterinary pathology field* Leadership and people management experience * A track record of troubleshooting and analytical skillsYou will have excellent organisation, analytical, technical and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels. You will have the ability to build and maintain excellent working relationships with a hierarchy of scientists and senior management. This is an excellent opportunity for personal development and to progress your professional career, in a growing commercial business which invests in training and offers a supportive and friendly working environment. You will be rewarded with a considerable salary and benefits package.The recruiter has stated that all applicants for this job should be able to prove that they are legally entitled to work in the UK.         Regulatory Affairs Specialist – Medical Devices – SloughA growing medical devices company in Slough are currently in need of an experienced regulatory affairs specialist who will be able to assist with the management of regulatory affairs standards on a range of medical devices.This is a unique role as you will work on more than one medical device, due to this you will ideally have worked for a few different medical devices companies (on different types of devices), worked for a company that produces several different types of devices or worked for a notified body where your product knowledge is utilised.This is a key role in the development of life-saving and life-improving medical devices. You will work closely with the quality assurance and design teams, within a ISO 13485 environment.It is expected that you would have a strong knowledge of regulatory standards within the UK and Europe. So, in-depth knowledge of ISO 13485, CE Marking other standards will be essential. This role will also give you much desired exposure to FDA 510K submissions. Undertaking internal audits will be important in this role so hopefully you have experience of this in your current role.It is understood that you would most likely hold a degree within an engineering, design, medical or sciences background, however the industry exposure is more important than your education, for this role.You will be rewarded with a challenging role that you will never get bored with. As new medical devices are being developed all the time you will always be working on something new rather than managing pre-existing regulatory affairs documentation.Also, you will have an excellent starting salary, bonus, benefits package and career progression. For more information, please feel free to call Matthew Lowdon, Director of Medical Devices recruitment and Scientific recruitment specialists Newton Colmore Consulting, on 0121 268 2240 or make an application and one of our team at Newton Colmore Consulting will contact you.Newton Colmore Consulting is a specialist recruitment company within the Medical Devices, Scientific Engineering, Scientific Software, Robotics, Science, Electronics Design, New Product Design, Human Factors, Regulatory Affairs, Quality Assurance and Field Service Engineering sectors.Medical Devices Regulatory Affairs Specialist, RA Specialist, Regulatory Affairs Manager, Quality Assurance, ISO 13485, CE Mark, CE Marking, FDA 510k, RA Consultant, RA Manager, Regulatory Affairs Consultant

title: Data Scientist Robotics Cambridge
description:
Data Scientist – Robotics– Cambridge
	








, 






Negotiable plus benefits










Permanent


Posted 19 days ago


























        Data Scientist – Robotics– Cambridge An up-and-coming robotics firm within the vibrant Cambridge technology cluster are actively looking for an experienced machine learning data scientist to join their highly-regarded data science and analytics team.This exciting new role will give the Data Scientist an opportunity to work alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry as well as on some of the most exciting technologies in the sector. In terms of day to day activities you will be responsible for and take lead on several projects across the robotics field, with a focus on machine and computer vision technologies. You will use your analytical skills to understand the project brief and foresee any technical challenges that may arise as well as taking lead on the project. We are looking for people who enjoy solving complex problems, that either revolve around improving efficiency of products or services or aim to save and improve people’s lives. We are considering people from graduate level through to senior experience.To be considered for this exciting role you will need to have a degree in Mathematics, Computer Science or other related subjects and will have a thorough understanding of data science whilst possessing an innovative and forward thinking mind-set. You will need to have exposure to Python and ideally Tensorflow as well as deep neural networks. Any experience with computer vision and imaging would be extremely advantageous. In exchange for your skills and expertise, the company offer a highly competitive package as well as providing excellent career progression and training. The company also offer relocation packages to make a move as easy as possible for you. Due to the nature of the business you will always have something new on the horizon as well time dedicated to personal projects and ideas. For more information, please call Matthew Lowdon of Newton Colmore Consulting on 0044 121 268 2240 or make an application and one of our team will be in touch. Newton Colmore Consulting is a highly specialist recruitment consultancy operating within the medical devices and scientific technology sectors, across Europe. We partner with companies, ranging from early stage start-ups through to multinationals, helping them secure highly sought after skill sets. Key words: Data Scientist, Algorithm Developer, Communications, Tracking, Sensing, Bayesian Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Machine Learning

title: Senior Data Scientist Complex Technology Cambridge
description:
Senior Data Scientist – Complex Technology – Cambridge
	








, 






Negotiable plus benefits










Permanent


Posted 19 days ago


























        Senior Data Scientist – Complex Technology – CambridgeA start-up technology company in Cambridge is actively looking for an experienced Data Scientist to take lead on various cutting edge projects.This exciting role, borne out of growth and the recent securing of funding will give the Senior Data Scientist an opportunity to work alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry as well as on some of the most exciting technologies in the sector. In terms of day to day activities you will be responsible for and take lead on a number of projects around sensing technologies. These include low volume, high value sensors for subsea environments as well as low value, high volume dispensing systems and connected devices. You will be extracting key information from both structured and unstructured sources by designing algorithms and analytical methods. To be considered for this exciting role you will need to have a degree in Mathematics, Computer Science or other related subjects and will have a thorough understanding of data science whilst possessing an innovative and forward thinking mindset. You will also need experience with implementing analytical algorithms and ideally have knowledge of both machine learning and Bayesian statistics. In exchange for your skills and expertise, the company offer a highly competitive package as well as providing excellent career progression and training. The company also offer relocation packages to make a move as easy as possible for you. Due to the nature of the business you will always have something new on the horizon as well time dedicated to personal projects and ideas. For more information, please call Matthew Lowdon of Newton Colmore Consulting on 0044 121 268 2240 or make an application and one of our team will be in touch. Newton Colmore Consulting is a highly specialist recruitment consultancy operating within the medical devices, Scientific Engineering, Data Science, Scientific Software, Robotics, Science, Electronics Design, New Product Design, Human Factors, Regulatory Affairs, Quality Assurance and Field Service Engineering sectors throughout Europe and the US.Key words: Data Scientist, Defence, Communications, Tracking, Sensing, Bayesian Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Analytical Algorithms, Algorithm Developer



Contact: Matthew Lowdon
        

Reference: Totaljobs/ML-JU-039283

title: Asbestos Lead Surveyor - P402 - South East
description:
Our client provides a range of asbestos and environmental services which include sampling suspected materials, bulk samples, asbestos analysis, air testing and surveying to a mixed portfolio of clients and due to current state of the business, they require a self-motivated, enthusiastic and multi-skilled Asbestos Lead Surveyor to join their busy office/team in the South East. Applications will be considered from London, Hertfordshire and the surrounding areas.Qualifications & Experience:Ideally, the applicant must hold the P402 or the equivalent - RSPH qualification and must have significant varied experience working within this role and within the asbestos sector.Must have good communication skills, both written and verbal.Must be IT literate and be well versed with the Health & Safety procedures appertaining to asbestos.Key Responsibilities:Duties will include site work - undertaking asbestos Management, Refurbishment/Demolition surveys on various properties, including commercial and industrial.Producing comprehensive asbestos reports as and when required.Developing and maintaining good working relationship with the company's portfolio of clients.Managing junior staff and training them on site and carrying out consultancy duties as and when required.Assisting in managing projects - preparing fee proposals - technical co-ordination and auditing - in line with the company's UKAS procedures.Requirements/Attributes:Ideally, the successful candidate will be a good team player, an all-rounder, flexible and have the ability to work independently and effectively and within time line.Prioritizing and managing workload.Traveling to sites as and when required. This role comes with an attractive salary, depending expertise, company vehicle and along with other benefits and also the opportunity to progress within the company.Future Select are the leading market supplier for recruitment in the Asbestos industry, we work with the best clients & candidates and supply the majority of permanent jobs in the asbestos market. We have a large dedicated team, with over 25 years combined industry experience within Asbestos recruitment specifically geared to dealing with Asbestos Surveyors/Analysts/Lab Technicians, Administrators, Project/Regional /Technical/Quality/Training/Sales Managers through to Director level for both Consultancy & Removal. We have intrinsic knowledge of the market place, as well as respecting candidates/clients confidentiality in this close knit market sector.We are also interested in anyone with p401/p402/p403/p404/p404 or s301 CCP.We are inundated with applications, we will endeavour to get back in touch, however if you have applied to Future Select and you have not heard from us after a week, on this occasion, you will not have been successful. Your details will be saved on our system and you will be contacted in the future if a vacancy matches your skills.Future Select Copyright 2017.

title: Market Access [Medical] Writer Payer Communications
description:
Evidera is one of the preeminent commercial entities analysing effectiveness, establishing evidence, and substantiating value of health treatments within the global health industry. Through its market leading portfolio of health economics, outcomes research, market access, data analytics and epidemiology services, it partners with life sciences organisations worldwide to optimise the market access and commercial success of their products. With an exceptional reputation and premium capabilities, we leverage our unparalleled knowledge of the global payer and regulator landscape and by developing, capturing and communicating the clinical and economic evidence that our clients require to successfully market their products. Our research and consulting services are driven by world-class science and thought leadership and leverage a unique combination of capabilities.DepartmentEvidera’s Payer Communications team interprets and communicates the clinical and economic evidence that our pharmaceutical/life sciences clients require to successfully market their products. Our services include global value dossiers, HTA submissions (e.g. NICE, SMC and others) and slide decks that provide healthcare decision-makers with the evidence they need to evaluate new medical treatments, targeted literature-based white papers on diseases and treatments, and reports from payer advisory boards. The practice has one of the best available networks of approximately 2,000 high level payers and advisers covering 45 markets, and has completed over 1,250 global and emerging markets projects, over 30,000 in-house payer interviews, and more than 200 Global Value Dossiers during the 17 years since its inception.Role and ResponsibilitiesWe are looking for a Summer Intern to work as a Market Access Writer in our Payer Communications team based in London. The role will involve supporting the team on projects for global pharmaceutical clients:•Value Dossiers and value stories to support the case for funding new products•Literature reviews •Analyses of the pricing, reimbursement and competitive landscapesThis position is an excellent opportunity to gain market access writing experience within a dynamic and commercial consultancy environment. There may be opportunities for permanent employment directly following a successful placement or in the future, depending on the company’s business needs.The Market Access Writer is a team-based, collaborative writing role in which you will apply scientific and writing expertise to projects covering a wide range of therapeutic areas. Typical duties include:•Writing fully-referenced content, for global value dossiers and HTA submissions, based on published clinical, scientific, and pharmacoeconomic literature•Developing simple visuals and graphics (e.g., in Excel or PowerPoint)•Editing, quality assurance, and formatting•Daily communication and teamwork with colleagues in the Payer Communications team •Workload management to meet internal and client-driven deadlinesSkills and ExperienceThe successful candidate is a highly motivated, detail-oriented, and organised self-starter who works well independently and on teams. Enthusiasm for a professional writing career and excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential. Essential•Technical writing skills balanced with ability to clearly convey complex information•Ability to understand and synthesise clinical, economic and commercial information•Research and analysis skills e.g. ability to undertake reviews of the scientific literature •Organisational skills to manage workload independently•Ability to rapidly absorb information on different diseases and therapy areas •Ability to work on own initiative, prioritise and work to deadlines•Ability to demonstrate writing skills, attention to detail and enthusiasm for career in scientific writing•Fluent written and spoken English essential•MS Word, PowerPoint, ExcelDesirable•Knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry and drug development process•Familiarity with clinical trial design and statistics•Understanding of market access and health economics•Familiarity with EndNote/Reference Manager Education•Current undergraduate or post-graduate student in a discipline related to Health Economics, Health Care, Health Research or Medical Writing The successful intern will be paid inline with London Living Wage £341.25pw (£9.75 per hour)Intern FAQs •What can I expect from an internship experience at Evidera? Interns at Evidera will put their background in research and theory to practice, while working with world-class scientists and consultants. Our interns are considered full team members and are given real work with real problems to solve. An internship project/programme that reflects both your skills and interests, as well as the business needs of the team will be developed upon your selection and acceptance.•What qualifications is Evidera looking for in intern candidates? Intern candidates must be enrolled in a post graduate degree and have an interest in a healthcare focused career in research/consulting. Previous relevant experience is desirable.•May I volunteer for the summer? We do not accept volunteers.•Where is the internship located? The internship will be based at the Evidera European Headquarters in Hammersmith, London.•If selected, will you help me find housing in the area? Interns are responsible for arranging their own housing and relocation expenses if necessary. •What is the work schedule?Unless otherwise agreed during the selection process, you’ll be expected to work a 35 hour a week schedule, and be paid for that work on an hourly basis.  •Do internships lead to permanent jobs at Evidera? While we cannot guarantee anyone a permanent position, we hope that the internship programme will provide you with valuable insights into what working at Evidera would be like. When you finish your degree we would be more than happy to discuss any available employment opportunities.


Contact: Jarrod Ruth
        

Reference: Totaljobs
        

Job ID: 74499091

title: Project Manager (12 Month Contract)
description:
Job DescriptionWe provide world-class expertise to unlock the skills and experience of our NHS partners to strengthen the quality, delivery and efficiency of pathology services. Currently, because of operational growth, we are seeking a Project Manager on a 12 month fixed-term-contract.Primarily, the successful Project Manager will be based in the Basildon area. The purpose of the role is to support and manage important and complex projects for our services located in Essex, in a way that is consistent with our strategy and values. S/he shall provide professional project management expertise across multiple assignments to ensure the delivery of IT solutions, integration of new equipment and implementation of service and process improvements to the required quality within budget and deadlines.Other Duties include:Develop and implement project plans for the management, coordination and facilitation of projects.Ensure project scope, goals, benefits and deliverables are defined.Manage project risks and inter-dependencies in according to tolerances set by project governance.Ensure operational participation in the planning, progress and completion of projects.Develop communication documents to structure the communication of projects.Develop, maintain, monitor and report on project risks, assumptions, issues and dependencies. Review all of these at appropriate periods. Resolve project issues with stakeholders.To work with and support work-stream leads, managers, consultant pathologists, other staff and stakeholders developing a multi-disciplinary and multi-service approach, by creating, sharing, influencing and implementing new processes and ways of working.Manage the Project Management Officer to enable them to perform the role to the best of their ability. Provide direction and support.Desired Skills and ExperienceAt least 3 years’ experience as a Project ManagerProject Management qualification (Prince 2 Practitioner preferred).Experience of LEAN methodologies within a fast changing environment.Has a track record of delivering complex business change and ICT projects from initiation phase through to project closure.Knowledge of the healthcare sector or NHS.Proven stakeholder management and communication skills.Experience in system configuration, testing, and documentationStrong financial management abilities.About UsIntegrated Pathology Partnerships (IPP) was established in 2010 to work in partnership with the NHS to deliver transformed pathology testing services in the UK. IPP now conducts more than 24 million tests per annum and employs over 700 staff across seven sites in the UK.IPP is a wholly-owned subsidiary of SYNLAB, the European leader in delivery of high quality pathology testing and imaging services. SYNLAB operates in 35 countries across four continents, employing more than 13,000 members of staff and conducting over 400 million tests per annum.

title: Code Governance Manager - Contract
description:
Contract, Top Pharma, Code Governance Manager - ABPI / IPHA * Code Governance Manager  My client a top pharma has a vacancy for Code Governance Manager to join their UK team.   Within this role you provide strategic leadership to develop and deliver a comprehensive Company continuous training and revalidation program in the ABPI / IPHA Code of Practice, to ensure that all company personnel are working compliantly on an ongoing basis.  You will act as an experienced mentor for new signatories and the Code Review team and be responsible for drafting and updating local Code governance documents and processes and delivering appropriate training and periodic audits to satisfy internal and external requirements.   To be considered for this role you will possess a Life science degree and training qualification with a deep and thorough working knowledge of the ABPI and IPHA Code of Practice, including the complaints process. You will have an excellent understanding of local processes and training and validation programs and systems. Working knowledge of electronic approval systems, Mercury or Zinc is a must.  Before you apply for this position it is vital that you are in possession of an EU or UK passport or relevant visa to work without restrictions in the UK.   To apply for this position or if you want to discuss other roles that we are working on, please do not hesitate to contact Roberta Atkins on 0203 465 0045.
